verses.text: Better \add is\add* a dry morsel , and quietness therewith, than an house full of sacrifices \add with\add* strife.\f + \fr 17.1 \ft sacrifices: or, good cheer\f*
A wise servant shall have rule over a son that causeth shame , and shall have part of the inheritance among the brethren.
The fining pot \add is\add* for silver , and the furnace for gold : but the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* trieth the hearts.
A wicked doer giveth heed to false lips ; \add and\add* a liar giveth ear to a naughty tongue.
Whoso mocketh the poor reproacheth his Maker : \add and\add* he that is glad at calamities shall not be unpunished.\f + \fr 17.5 \ft unpunished: Heb. held innocent\f*
Children’s children \add are\add* the crown of old men ; and the glory of children \add are\add* their fathers.
Excellent speech becometh not a fool : much less do lying lips a prince.\f + \fr 17.7 \ft Excellent…: Heb. A lip of excellency\f*\f + \fr 17.7 \ft lying…: Heb. a lip of lying\f*
A gift \add is as\add* a precious stone in the eyes of him that hath it: whithersoever it turneth , it prospereth.\f + \fr 17.8 \ft a precious…: Heb. a stone of grace\f*
He that covereth a transgression seeketh love ; but he that repeateth a matter separateth \add very\add* friends.\f + \fr 17.9 \ft seeketh: or, procureth\f*
A reproof entereth more into a wise man than an hundred stripes into a fool.\f + \fr 17.10 \ft entereth…: or, aweth more a wise man, than to strike a fool an hundred times\f*
An evil \add man\add* seeketh only rebellion : therefore a cruel messenger shall be sent against him.
Let a bear robbed of her whelps meet a man , rather than a fool in his folly.
Whoso rewardeth evil for good , evil shall not depart from his house.
The beginning of strife \add is as\add* when one letteth out water : therefore leave off contention , before it be meddled with.
He that justifieth the wicked , and he that condemneth the just , even they both \add are\add* abomination to the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*.
Wherefore \add is there\add* a price in the hand of a fool to get wisdom , seeing \add he hath\add* no heart \add to it\add*?
A friend loveth at all times , and a brother is born for adversity.
A man void of understanding striketh hands , \add and\add* becometh surety in the presence of his friend.\f + \fr 17.18 \ft understanding: Heb. heart\f*
He loveth transgression that loveth strife : \add and\add* he that exalteth his gate seeketh destruction.
He that hath a froward heart findeth no good : and he that hath a perverse tongue falleth into mischief.\f + \fr 17.20 \ft He that hath a froward…: Heb. The froward of heart\f*
He that begetteth a fool \add doeth it\add* to his sorrow : and the father of a fool hath no joy.
A merry heart doeth good \add like\add* a medicine : but a broken spirit drieth the bones.\f + \fr 17.22 \ft like: or, to\f*
A wicked \add man\add* taketh a gift out of the bosom to pervert the ways of judgment.
Wisdom \add is\add* before him that hath understanding ; but the eyes of a fool \add are\add* in the ends of the earth.
A foolish son \add is\add* a grief to his father , and bitterness to her that bare him.
Also to punish the just \add is\add* not good , \add nor\add* to strike princes for equity. \p
He that hath knowledge spareth his words : \add and\add* a man of understanding is of an excellent spirit.\f + \fr 17.27 \ft an…: or, a cool\f*
Even a fool , when he holdeth his peace , is counted wise : \add and\add* he that shutteth his lips \add is esteemed\add* a man of understanding.
